sen.j: 源頼国（みなもとのよりくに、生年未詳 - 天喜元年(1058年)?）は平安時代の武将・官人。
sen.e: "MINAMOTO no Yorikuni" was a warlord & a court official in the Heian period, and although his birth year is unknown, his death year is supposed to be 1058.

sen.j: 正四位下、蔵人、左衛門尉、讃岐国守、美濃国守。
sen.e: His career of title & rank was "Shoshiinoge" (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), "Kurodo" (The Palace Officer), "Saemon no jo" (sub-lieutenant of the Left Gate Guards), "Sanuki no kuni no kami" (Provincial Governor of Sanuki) and "Mino no kuni no kami" (Provincial Governor of Mino).

sen.j: 父の頼光同様、主に京における中級官人として活動する。
sen.e: He worked mainly as a middle-ranking court official in Kyoto like his father Yorimitsu.

sen.j: 特に藤原道長一族との結びつきが強く、道長の娘藤原彰子、その所生の皇子敦成親王（後一条天皇）に長きに渡って近侍した。
sen.e: He was connected especially with the FUJIWARA no Michinaga family, so he worked for a long time as a valet of Michinaga's daughter "FUJIWARA no Akiko" & her birth child Imperial Prince Atsuhira (Emperor Goichijo in later years).

sen.j: 武人としてよりも文人としての活動が主体であり、寛弘4年(1007年)に道長の催した漢詩の会に出席したことなどが記録に見える。
sen.e: His activities were centered on those of a litterateur rather than a warrior, so in a document there is a description that he attended the "Kanshi" (Chinese poem) party held by Michinaga in 1007.

sen.j: 内昇殿を許され、娘達を摂政藤原師実、参議藤原為房といった公卿の妻妾に配すなど、総じて貴族社会の一員としての側面が強かった。
sen.e: He was permitted to enter "Tenjo no ma" (the station within the Imperial Palace only available to a limited number of high-ranking court nobles), and he sent over his daughters as wives and concubines of "kugyo" (the top court officials), such as the "Sessho" (Regent) FUJIWARA no Morozane & "Sangi" (Royal Adviser) FUJIWARA no Tamefusa, and therefore, as a whole, his aspect as a member of the aristocratic society was more noticeable than that of the warrior society.
sen.cmt: ※「内昇殿」とは「殿上の間（限られた高官のみ出入りを許された宮中の詰所）への伺候を許されること」（集英社・国語辞典、kotobank.jp デジタル大辞泉参照）なので、左の解説部分でもそう訳しています。

He was admitted to the inner Court, and sent over his daughters as wives and concubines of kugyo (the top court officials), such as the Sessho (Regent) FUJIWARA no Morozane and Sangi (councilor) FUJIWARA no Tamefusa, and therefore, as a whole, his aspect as a member of the aristocratic society was more noticeable than that of the warrior society.

sen.j: 反面、武人としての事績に目立ったものはなく、寛仁3年(1019年)に暴漢を逮捕したことなど、主に京周辺の警察的活動に従事した。
sen.e: Meanwhile, there were no remarkable achievements as a warrior, but in 1019, when he was engaged in police activities around Kyoto, he arrested a thug.

sen.j: 男子では源頼弘、源頼資、源頼実、源実国、源頼綱、源国房、源師光などがあり、頼実、頼綱、師光は歌人として名を残しているほか、頼資、頼綱、国房らの子孫は後代武門として様々な形で歴史に名を刻んでいる。
sen.e: His sons were MINAMOTO no Yorihiro, MINAMOTO no Yorisuke, MINAMOTO no Yorizane, MINAMOTO no Sanekuni, MINAMOTO no Yoritsuna, MINAMOTO no Kunifusa, MINAMOTO no Moromitsu and others, and of these sons, Yorizane, Yoritsuna and Moromitsu left their names behind as a poet, and Yorisuke, Yoritsuna and Kunifusa had descendants who inscribed their names in various forms upon history in later years as a military family;

sen.j: また娘達のうち、師実妻は左大臣藤原家忠、為房妻は参議藤原為隆、権中納言藤原顕隆らをそれぞれ生んだことで知られ、さらに別の娘の一人は歌人「六条斎院宣旨」として名を残している。
sen.e: and of his daughthers, Morozane's wife is known to have given birth to "FUJIWARA no Ietada" who rose to "Sadaijin" (Great Minister of the Left), and Tamefusa's wife is known to have given birth both to "FUJIWARA no Tametaka" who rose to "Sangi" (Royal Adviser), and to "FUJIWARA no Akitaka" who rose to "Gon no chunagon" (Deputy Middle Councilor), and another daughter left her name behind as a poet "Rokujosai-in no senji."

And of his daughters, Morozane's wife is known to have given birth to FUJIWARA no Ietada of Sadaijin (Great Minister of the Left) and Tamefusa's wife is known to have given birth both to FUJIWARA no Tametaka of Sangi and to FUJIWARA no Akitaka of Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state); another daughter left her name behind as a poet 'Rokujosaiin no senji.'
